meanings.definition: The quality or state of being urban.
meanings.sent1: The urbanity of the city was evident in its bustling streets and towering skyscrapers.
meanings.sent2: She admired the urbanity of the downtown area with its trendy cafes and modern architecture.
meanings.sent3: The urbanity of the town was so striking that even the rural visitors felt a bit out of place.
meanings.sent4: His outfit exuded an urbanity that made him stand out in the crowd of casual dressers.
meanings.sent5: The urbanity of the metropolis was a stark contrast to the simplicity of the countryside.

meanings.sent1: Her urbanity shone through as she greeted each guest with a warm smile and a firm handshake.
meanings.sent2: The diplomat's urbanity was evident in the way he handled even the most difficult negotiations with grace.
meanings.sent3: Despite his gruff appearance, his urbanity in social situations always surprised those who met him for the first time.
meanings.sent4: The urbanity of her speech and gestures made her the perfect hostess for the elegant soirée.
meanings.sent5: His urbanity was so natural that it seemed to effortlessly charm everyone he encountered.
